entry.definition: acronym for Associate in Arts , a college degree granted for successful completion of a two-year course of study in arts or general topics.

the American Association for the Advancement of Science , an organization with headquarters in Washington, D.C. Its goal is to advance the physical and social sciences, and it publishes a weekly journal Science , with original research articles as well as reviews and commentary.
A Dutch and German measure of liquids, varying in different cities, being at Amsterdam about 41 wine gallons, at Antwerp 36 1/2 , at Hamburg 38 1/4 .
an associate degree conferred for successful studies in applied science.
The fifth month of the Jewish year according to the ecclesiastical reckoning, the eleventh by the civil computation, coinciding nearly with August.
The Manila-hemp plant ( Musa textilis ); also, its fiber. See Manila hemp under Manila .
Toward the back or rear; backward.
The rhinoceros.
Behind; toward the stern from; as, abaft the wheelhouse .
To abandon.
To destroy the self-possession of; to confuse or confound, as by exciting suddenly a consciousness of guilt, mistake, or inferiority; to put to shame; to disconcert; to discomfit.
To beat down; to overthrow.
Barking; baying of dogs upon their prey. See Bay .
Among weavers, yarn for the warp. Hence, abb wool is wool for the abb .
Father; religious superior; -- in the Syriac, Coptic, and Ethiopic churches, a title given to the bishops, and by the bishops to the patriarch.
A monastery or society of persons of either sex, secluded from the world and devoted to religion and celibacy; also, the monastic building or buildings.
The superior or head of an abbey.
The first three letters of the alphabet, used for the whole alphabet.
A religious devotee or dervish in Persia.
On the beam, that is, on a line which forms a right angle with the ship's keel; opposite to the center of the ship's side.
To bear; to behave.
In bed, or on the bed.
The white poplar ( Populus alba ).
To wander; to stray.
To instigate or encourage by aid or countenance; -- used in a bad sense of persons and acts; as, to abet an ill-doer; to abet one in his wicked courses; to abet vice; to abet an insurrection.
The berries of a species of cypress in the East Indies.
To shrink back with shuddering from; to regard with horror or detestation; to feel excessive repugnance toward; to detest to extremity; to loathe.
The first month of the Jewish ecclesiastical year, corresponding nearly to our April. After the Babylonish captivity this month was called Nisan .
To wait; to pause; to delay.
A genus of coniferous trees, properly called Fir, as the balsam fir and the silver fir. The spruces are sometimes also referred to this genus.
3d sing. pres. of Abide .
Fit; adapted; suitable.
comp. of Able .
A small fresh-water fish ( Leuciscus alburnus ); the bleak.
In an able manner; with great ability; as, ably done, planned, said .
The girdle of a Jewish priest or officer.
pret. of Abide .
A large South American serpent ( Boa aboma ).
and adv . Above.
a language spoken in Northeast India and adjacent regions of West Burma (Myanmar).
Manner of approaching or accosting; address.
to cause (an action or process) to stop at an early stage, or before normal completion; as, to abort a rocket flight .
On all sides; around.
In or to a higher place; higher than; on or over the upper surface; over; -- opposed to below or beneath .
Braced aback.
A narrow pass or defile; a break in a mesa; the mouth of a cañon.
See Abraid .
The abductor muscles of the stomach; -- a contraction used by body-building and health enthusiasts. Used similarly to pecs and delts .
See Apsis .
The capital city of Nigeria . Population (2000) = 339,000.
The Patriarch, or head of the Abyssinian Church.

To put to a wrong use; to misapply; to misuse; to put to a bad use; to use for a wrong purpose or end; to pervert; as, to abuse inherited gold ; to make an excessive use of; as, to abuse one's authority .
To project; to terminate or border; to be contiguous; to meet; -- with on , upon , or against ; as, his land abuts on the road .
In a buzz; buzzing.
atone for, make amends for
An abyss; a gulf.
A bottomless or unfathomed depth, gulf, or chasm; hence, any deep, immeasurable, and, specifically, hell, or the bottomless pit.
the chemical symbol for actinum , a radioactive element.
To render quiet; to soothe.
The capital city of Ghana . Population (2000) = nk.
of the highest quality
type genus of the Aceraceae; trees or shrubs having winged fruit.
Sour, bitter, and harsh to the taste, as unripe fruit; sharp and harsh.
A name given to several species of plants; as, smallage, wild celery, parsley.
Continued pain, as distinguished from sudden twinges, or spasmodic pain. “Such an ache in my bones.”
Sour, sharp, or biting to the taste; tart; having the taste of vinegar: as, acid fruits or liquors. Also fig.: Sour-tempered.
red pear-shaped tropical fruit with poisonous seeds; its flesh is poisonous when unripe or overripe.
The top or highest point; the culmination.
Inflammation of the sebaceous glands that are associated with hair follicles, leading to visible comedones and pimples, especially on the face, back, and chest.
In a cocked or turned up fashion.
The fruit of the oak, being an oval nut growing in a woody cup or cupule.
Any field of arable or pasture land.
Possessing acres or landed property; -- used in composition; as, large- acred men .
Sharp and harsh, or bitter and not, to the taste; pungent; as, acrid salts .
That which is done or doing; the exercise of power, or the effect, of which power exerted is the cause; a performance; a deed.
a growth hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland; stimulates the adrenal cortex.
A stuffed jacket worn under the mail, or (later) a jacket plated with mail.
One who acts, or takes part in any affair; a doer.
one of the books of the Christian New Testament describing the activities of Christ's apostles after his death.
Sharp at the end; ending in a sharp point; pointed; -- opposed to blunt or obtuse ; as, an acute angle; an acute leaf.
An acid radical, as acetyl, malonyl, or benzoyl. An acyl radical can be depicted as R-CO- , where -CO- is the carbonyl group, and R is the group that characterizes the acyl moiety.
To compel; to drive.
the Babylonian god of storms and wind.
An old saying, which has obtained credit by long use; a proverb.
The name given in the Bible to the first man, the progenitor of the human race.
a demigod or first man: "seed of mankind"; sometimes identified with Adam.
Fitted; suited.
The twelfth month of the Hebrew ecclesiastical year, and the sixth of the civil. It corresponded nearly with March.
To subdue; to daunt.
By day, or every day; in the daytime.
To give by way of increased possession ( to any one); to bestow ( on ).
One of the largest African antelopes ( Hippotragusnasomaculatus or Oryx nasomaculatus ).
being in addition [to something else]
One who, or that which, adds; esp., a machine for adding numbers.
Having lost the power of development, and become rotten, as eggs; putrid. Hence: Unfruitful or confused, as brains; muddled.
To revoke, as a legacy, grant, etc., or to satisfy it by some other gift.
Animal fat; lard.
One fully skilled or well versed in anything; a proficient; as, adepts in philosophy .
Good-by; farewell; an expression of kind wishes at parting.
Adieu; farewell; good-by; -- chiefly used among Spanish-speaking people; as, adios amigos ( good-bye friends ) .
An entrance or passage. Specifically: The nearly horizontal opening by which a mine is entered, or by which water and ores are carried away; -- called also drift and tunnel .

To suffer to enter; to grant entrance, whether into a place, or into the mind, or consideration; to receive; to take; as, they were into his house; to admit a serious thought into the mind; to admit evidence in the trial of a cause.
To mingle with something else; to mix.
To do; in doing; as, there is nothing ado .
An unburnt brick dried in the sun; also used as an adjective, as, an adobe house, in Texas or New Mexico .
a Philippine dish of marinated vegetables and meat or fish; served with rice.
At the door; of the door; as, out adoors .
To take by choice into relationship, as, child, heir, friend, citizen, etc.; esp. to take voluntarily (a child of other parents) to be in the place of, or as, one's own child.
To worship with profound reverence; to pay divine honors to; to honor as a deity or as divine.
To deck or dress with ornaments; to embellish; to set off to advantage; to render pleasing or attractive.
From a higher to a lower situation; downward; down, to or on the ground.
Put in dread; afraid.
In a dripping state; as, leaves all adrip .
In a dry or thirsty condition.
Having arrived at maturity, or to full size and strength; matured; as, an adult person or plant; an adult ape; an adult age.
Hooked; as, a parrot has an adunc bill .
To burn up.
Inflamed or scorched; dried or darkened by heat.
a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medicine used to relieve the pain of arthritis and as an analgesic and antipyretic; Advil and Motrin and Nuprin are trademarks of brands of ibuprofen tablets.
A carpenter's or cooper's tool, formed with a thin arching blade set at right angles to the handle. It is used for chipping or slicing away the surface of wood.
A shield or protective armor; -- applied in mythology to the shield of Jupiter which he gave to Minerva . Also fig.: A shield; a protection.
A period of immeasurable duration. See Eon .
The nest of a bird of prey, as of an eagle or hawk; also a brood of such birds; eyrie. Shak. Also fig.: A human residence or resting place perched like an eagle's nest.
of or pertaining to aeronautics or aircraft.
At, to, or from a great distance; far away; -- often used with from preceding, or off following; as, he was seen from afar ; I saw him afar off.
The southwest wind.
To subjoin, annex, or add at the close or end; to append to; to fix to any part of; as, to affix a syllable to a word; to affix a seal to an instrument; to affix one's name to a writing.
To confide (one's self to , or in ); to trust.
the American Football League.
Level with the ground; flat.
In a foaming state; as, the sea is all afoam .
American Federation of Labor.
Before (in all its senses).
In collision; entangled.
A powerful evil jinnee, demon, or monstrous giant.
Near or towards the stern of a vessel; astern; abaft.
Next; later in time; subsequent; succeeding; as, an after period of life .
In Turkey, a commander or chief officer. It is used also as a title of respect.
In return, back; as, bring us word again .
A genus of lizards, one of the few which feed upon vegetable substances; also, one of these lizards.
A South American bird ( Psophia crepitans ), allied to the cranes, and easily domesticated; -- called also the gold-breasted trumpeter . Its body is about the size of the pheasant. See Trumpeter .
Gaping, as with wonder, expectation, or eager attention.
common shortened form of agar-agar{2} .
In a state of gasping.
To affright; to terrify.
On the way; agoing; as, to be agate ; to set the bells agate .
Of the nature of agate, or containing agate.

A genus of plants (order Amaryllidaceae ) of which the chief species is the maguey or century plant ( Agave Americana ), wrongly called Aloe. It takes from ten to seventy years, according to climate, to attain maturity, when it produces a gigantic flower stem, sometimes forty feet in height, and perishes. The juice has purgative and diuretic properties. The fermented juice is the pulque of the Mexicans; distilled, it yields mescal . A strong thread and a tough paper are made from the leaves, and the wood has many uses.
looking intently; -- used of eyes.
The whole duration of a being, whether animal, vegetable, or other kind; lifetime.
Old; having lived long; having lived almost to or beyond the usual time allotted to that species of being; as, an aged man; an aged oak.
See Again .
See Agendum .
Acting; -- opposed to patient , or sustaining, action.
An earthwork; a mound; a raised work.
aggravation or aggression.
Applied to a kind of variegated glass beads of ancient manufacture; as, aggry beads are found in Ashantee and Fantee in Africa .
Having the faculty of quick motion in the limbs; apt or ready to move; nimble; active; as, an agile boy; an agile tongue.

the process by which objects or materials acquire desirable qualities by being left undisturbed for some time under specific conditions. It is used mostly for foods snd beverages, but also for other materials.
The premium or percentage on a better sort of money when it is given in exchange for an inferior sort. The premium or discount on foreign bills of exchange is sometimes called agio .
discrimination against middle-aged and elderly people.
To take to graze or pasture, at a certain sum; -- used originally of the feeding of cattle in the king's forests, and collecting the money for the same.
A tag of a lace or of the points, braids, or cords formerly used in dress. They were sometimes formed into small images. Hence, “ aglet baby” ( Shak. ), an aglet image.
Aside; askew.
In a glow; glowing; as, cheeks aglow ; the landscape all aglow .
Past; gone by; since; as, ten years ago ; gone long ago .
In eager desire; eager; astir.
A contest for a prize at the public games.
Agonic line.
Violent contest or striving.
In earnest; heartily.
An assembly; hence, the place of assembly, especially the market place, in an ancient Greek city.
In good part; kindly.
To harmonize in opinion, statement, or action; to be in unison or concord; to be or become united or consistent; to concur; as, all parties agree in the expediency of the law .
In the act of grinning.
A disease occurring in Bengal and other parts of the East Indies, in which the tongue chaps and cleaves.
An acute fever.
In a gushing state.
An exclamation, expressive of surprise, pity, complaint, entreaty, contempt, threatening, delight, triumph, etc., according to the manner of utterance.
An exclamation expressing, by different intonations, triumph, mixed with derision or irony, or simple surprise.
In or to the front; in advance; onward.
In a heap; huddled together.
An exclamation to call one's attention; hem.
Near the wind; as, to lay a ship ahold .
A term used in hailing; as, “Ship ahoy .”
The Asiatic gazelle.
With the sails furled, and the helm lashed alee; -- applied to ships in a storm. See Hull , n.
The three-toed sloth ( Bradypus tridactylus ) of South America. See Sloth .
To support, either by furnishing strength or means in coöperation to effect a purpose, or to prevent or to remove evil; to help; to assist.
One who, or that which, aids.

To affect with pain or uneasiness, either physical or mental; to trouble; to be the matter with; -- used to express some uneasiness or affection, whose cause is unknown; as, what ails the man? I know not what ails him .
To point or direct a missile weapon, or a weapon which propels as missile, towards an object or spot with the intent of hitting it; as, to aim at a fox, or at a target .
One who aims, directs, or points.
belonging to or on behalf of a specified person especially one's self; preceded by a possessive.
same as Ainu .

One of a peculiar race found primarily in Hokkaido, in the northern part of the empire of Japan, the Kurile Islands, and nearby. They are believed to be the native inhabitants of the Japanese islands. The Ainus are stout and short, with hairy bodies. Also called Aino and hairy Ainu .
a French garlic-flavored mayonnaise. It is often served with fish and other seafood, and sometimes with vegetables.
The fluid which we breathe, and which surrounds the earth; the atmosphere. It is invisible, inodorous, insipid, transparent, compressible, elastic, and ponderable.
abounding in fresh air.
One who exposes to the air.
A grayish green antiseptic powder, consisting of a basic iodide and gallate of bismuth, sometimes used in place of iodoform.
to pick one's way.
Consisting of air; as, an airy substance; the airy parts of bodies.

A lateral division of a building, separated from the middle part, called the nave, by a row of columns or piers, which support the roof or an upper wall containing windows, called the clearstory wall.
An islet, or little isle, in a river or lake; an eyot.
The letter h or H.
Slightly turned or opened; as, the door was standing ajar .
See Ajouan .
On the jog.
of or pertaining to objects which are pierced or decorated with an openwork pattern.
a tree ( Blighia sapida ) widely cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions for its fragrant flowers and colorful fruits; introduced in Jamaica by Captain Bligh of the HMS Bounty.
Same as Achene .
Of the same kin; related by blood; -- used of persons; as, the two families are near akin .
On the knee.
Earlier form of Acknow .
the chemical symbol for aluminum.
A winglike organ, or part.
An exclamation expressive of sorrow.
A wolfhound.
On land; to the land; ashore.
Pertaining to, or having, wings.
A summons to arms, as on the approach of an enemy.
Of or pertaining to wings; also, wing-shaped.
An exclamation expressive of sorrow, pity, or apprehension of evil; -- in old writers, sometimes followed by day or white ; alas the day , like alack a day , or alas the white .
Lately; of late.

A vestment of white linen, reaching to the feet, an enveloping the person; -- in the Roman Catholic church, worn by those in holy orders when officiating at mass. It was formerly worn, at least by clerics, in daily life.
A white crystalline resinous substance extracted from gutta-percha by the action of alcohol or ether.
Although; albeit.
A white tablet on which anything was inscribed, as a list of names, etc.
Scotland; esp. the Highlands of Scotland.
a genus of elk or moose.
A small South American dog, domesticated by the aborigines.
Continually.

A tree, usually growing in moist land, and belonging to the genus Alnus . The wood is used by turners, etc.; the bark by dyers and tanners. In the U. S. the species of alder are usually shrubs or small trees.

A colorless liquid, C4H8O2 , obtained by condensation of two molecules of acetaldehyde: CH3CHO + CH3CHO = H3CH(OH)CH2CO ; also, any of various derivatives of this. The same reaction has been applied, under the name of aldol condensation , to the production of many compounds.
An intoxicating liquor made from an infusion of malt by fermentation and the addition of a bitter, usually hops.
In a leaking condition.
On or toward the lee, or the side away from the wind; the opposite of aweather . The helm of a ship is alee when pressed close to the lee side.
The imperial standard of the Turkish Empire.
Watchful; vigilant; active in vigilance.
a member of the people inhabiting the Aleutian Islands. Same as Aleutian , n.
A plant ( Macrochloa tenacissima ) of North Africa; also, its fiber, used in paper making.
A caldron of boiling water into which an accused person plunged his forearm as a test of innocence or guilt.

A kind of seaweed; pl. the class of cellular cryptogamic plants which includes the black, red, and green seaweeds, as kelp, dulse, sea lettuce, also marine and fresh water confervæ, etc. The algae are primitive chlorophyll-containing mainly aquatic eukaryotic organisms lacking true stems and roots and leaves.
plural of alga .
Pertaining to, or like, algæ.
Cold; chilly.
A nitrogenous substance resembling gelatin, obtained from certain algæ.
A fixed star, in Medusa's head, in the constellation Perseus, remarkable for its periodic variation in brightness.
Cold; chilliness.
Same as Almug (and etymologically preferable).

Otherwise; otherwise called; -- a term used in legal proceedings to connect the different names of any one who has gone by two or more, and whose true name is for any cause doubtful; as, Smith, alias Simpson .

The plea or mode of defense under which a person on trial for a crime proves or attempts to prove that he was in another place when the alleged act was committed; as, to set up an alibi ; to prove an alibi .
Not belonging to the same country, land, or government, or to the citizens or subjects thereof; foreign; as, alien subjects, enemies, property, shores .
On my life; dearly.
To adjust or form to a line; to range or form in line; to bring into line; to aline.
Having resemblance or similitude; similar; without difference.
To range or place in a line; to bring into line; to align.
Like ale; as, an alish taste .
Having life, in opposition to dead ; living; being in a state in which the organs perform their functions; as, an animal or a plant which is alive .

The whole quantity, extent, duration, amount, quality, or degree of; the whole; the whole number of; any whatever; every; as, all the wheat; all the land; all the year; all the strength; all happiness; all abundance; loss of all power; beyond all doubt; you will see us all (or all of us).
The name of the Supreme Being, in use among the Arabs and the Muslims generally.
To make quiet or put at rest; to pacify or appease; to quell; to calm; as, to allay popular excitement; to allay the tumult of the passions.
Same as Alder , of all.
A narrow passage; especially a walk or passage in a garden or park, bordered by rows of trees or bushes; a bordered way.
a European shad, ( Alosa alosa ).
See Allodium .
To incite dogs by a call; to halloo.
To distribute by lot.
To praise; to approve of; hence, to sanction.

Any combination or compound of metals fused together; a mixture of metals; for example, brass, which is an alloy of copper and zinc. But when mercury is one of the metals, the compound is called an amalgam .
To unite, or form a connection between, as between families by marriage, or between princes and states by treaty, league, or confederacy; -- often followed by to or with .
An organic radical, C3H5 , existing especially in oils of garlic and mustard.
Same as Alme .
An Egyptian dancing girl; an Alma.
See Almonry .
Anything given gratuitously to relieve the poor, as money, food, or clothing; a gift of charity.
A tree or wood of the Bible (2 Chron. ii. 8; 1 K. x. 11).
The wood of the agalloch.
a purgative made from the leaves of aloe. Same as aloe{3} .
On high; in the air; high above the ground.
Unreasonableness; absurdity.
A bitter purgative principle in aloes.
Quite by one's self; apart from, or exclusive of, others; single; solitary; -- applied to a person or thing.
By the length; in a line with the length; lengthwise.
Same as Alewife .
the genus comprising the most common varieties of shad. It replaces the older term Clupea . See also shad .

The European shad ( Alosa alosa formerly Clupea alosa ); -- called also allice shad or allis shad . The name is sometimes applied to the American shad ( Alosa sapidissima formerly Clupea sapidissima ). See Shad .
With a loud voice, or great noise; loudly; audibly.
Below; in a lower part.
A very high mountain. Specifically, in the plural, the highest chain of mountains in Europe, containing the lofty mountains of Switzerland, etc.
Of or pertaining to the Alps.
The first letter in the Greek alphabet, answering to A, and hence used to denote the beginning .
In like manner; likewise.
The higher part of the scale. See Alto .
A raised structure (as a square or oblong erection of stone or wood) on which sacrifices are offered or incense burned to a deity.
To make otherwise; to change in some respect, either partially or wholly; to vary; to modify.

Formerly the part sung by the highest male, or counter-tenor, voices; now the part sung by the lowest female, or contralto, voices, between in tenor and soprano. In instrumental music it now signifies the tenor.
A false or bastard wing. See under Bastard .
A double sulphate formed of aluminium and some other element (esp. an alkali metal) or of aluminium. It has twenty-four molecules of water of crystallization.
A walk or passage; -- applied to passages of various kinds.
The first person singular of the verb be , in the indicative mode, present tense. See Be .
a woman hired to suckle a child of someone else.
With might; with full force; vigorously; violently; exceedingly.
To collect into a mass or heap; to gather a great quantity of; to accumulate; as, to amass a treasure or a fortune; to amass words or phrases.
To dismay; to dishearten; to daunt.
To bewilder; to stupefy; to bring into a maze.

A yellowish translucent resin resembling copal, found as a fossil in alluvial soils, with beds of lignite, or on the seashore in many places. It takes a fine polish, and is used for pipe mouthpieces, beads, etc., and as a basis for a fine varnish. By friction, it becomes strongly electric.
Circuit or compass.
To go at the easy gait called an amble; -- applied to the horse or to its rider.
A large pulpit or reading desk, in the early Christian churches.
Same as Ambo .
In churches, a kind of closet, niche, cupboard, or locker for utensils, vestments, etc.
naked freshwater or marine or parasitic protozoa that form temporary pseudopods for feeding and locomotion. Same as amoeba .
an independent ruler or chieftan (especially in Africa or Arabia). Same as Emir .
An expression used at the end of prayers, and meaning, So be it . At the end of a creed, it is a solemn asseveration of belief. When it introduces a declaration, it is equivalent to truly , verily .
To change or modify in any way for the better
A species of inflorescence; a catkin.
Amice, a hood or cape. See 2d Amice .
A genus of fresh-water ganoid fishes, exclusively confined to North America; called bowfin in Lake Champlain, dogfish in Lake Erie, and mudfish in South Carolina, etc. See Bowfin .
Related to, or derived, ammonia; -- used chiefly as a suffix; as, amic acid; phosph amic acid.
A square of white linen worn at first on the head, but now about the neck and shoulders, by priests of the Roman Catholic Church while saying Mass.
See Amidst .
A compound formed by the union of amidogen with an acid element or radical. It may also be regarded as ammonia in which one or more hydrogen atoms have been replaced by an acid atom or radical.
Containing, or derived from, amidogen.
A friend; -- a Spanish term applied in the Philippine Islands to friendly natives.

One of a class of basic substances derived from ammonia by replacement of one or more hydrogen atoms by an alkyl or aryl group. Compare amide , in which an acyl group is attached to the nitrogen. Hydroxylamine and hydrazine, which are not an organic compounds, are also basic and may also be considered amines .
Same as Ameer .
The Amish Mennonites.
Astray; faultily; improperly; wrongly; ill.
Friendship, in a general sense, between individuals, societies, or nations; friendly relations; good understanding; as, a treaty of amity and commerce; the amity of the Whigs and Tories.
An abbes or spiritual mother.
The capital city of Jordan . Population (2000) = 963,490.
Any detergent plant, or the part of it used as a detergent, as the roots of Agave Americana , Chlorogalum pomeridianum , etc.
Mixed or mingled; surrounded by.
As if dead; lifeless; spiritless; dejected; depressed.
Love; affection.
To remove, as a person or thing, from a position.
Large; great in size, extent, capacity, or bulk; spacious; roomy; widely extended.
In an ample manner.
Same as Ampulla, 2.
A woman's headband (sometimes of metal), for binding the front hair.
The European ring ousel ( Turdus torquatus ).
An administrative territorial division in Denmark and Norway.
In a frenzied and reckless manner.
To occupy or engage the attention of; to lose in deep thought; to absorb; also, to distract; to bewilder.
An explosive consisting of ammonium nitrate, a derivative of nitrobenzene, chlorated napthalene, and wood meal.
A univalent hydrocarbon radical, C5H11 , of the paraffine series found in amyl alcohol or fusel oil, etc.
Same as Amice , a hood or cape.

This word is properly an adjective , but is commonly called the indefinite article . It is used before nouns of the singular number only, and signifies one , or any , but somewhat less emphatically. In such expressions as “twice an hour,” “once an age,” a shilling an ounce (see 2d A , 2), it has a distributive force, and is equivalent to each , every .
Of each; an equal quantity; as, wine and honey, ana (or, contracted, aa ) two ounces, &ounce_; ij. , that is, of wine and honey, each, two ounces.
Pertaining to, or situated near, the anus; as, the anal fin or glands .
An expression equivalent to What did you say? Sir? Eh?
A genus of water fowls, of the order Anseres, including certain species of fresh-water ducks.
a genus comprising the squash bugs.
See Ankle .
The olecranon, or the elbow.
A particle which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
To near; to approach.
The herb dill, or dillseed.
Over again; another time; in a new form; afresh; as, to arm anew ; to create anew .
A messenger.
Trouble; vexation; also, physical pain or smart of a sore, etc.
The inclosed space near the point where two lines meet; a corner; a nook.
Extreme anxiety.
Troublesome; vexatious; rigorous.
A black bird of tropical America, the West Indies and Florida ( Crotophaga ani ), allied to the cuckoos, having a compressed, bladelike bill and remarkable for communistic nesting.
A West Indian plant ( Indigofera anil ), one of the original sources of indigo; also, the indigo dye.
Old-womanish; imbecile.
An electro-negative atom or group of atoms, or the element which, in electro-chemical decompositions, is evolved at the anode; -- opposed to cation .
An umbelliferous plant ( Pimpinella anisum ) growing naturally in Egypt, and cultivated in Spain, Malta, etc., for its carminative and aromatic seeds.
In Guam and the Philippines, an idol, fetich, or spirit.
A liquid measure in various countries of Europe. The Dutch anker , formerly also used in England, contained about 10 of the old wine gallons, or 8 1/2 imperial gallons.
A tau cross with a loop at the top, used as an attribute or sacred emblem, symbolizing generation or enduring life. Called also crux ansata .
The joint which connects the foot with the leg; the tarsus.
An elephant goad with a sharp spike and hook, resembling a short-handled boat hook.
A half years's stipend, over and above what is owing for the incumbency, due to a minister's heirs after his decease.
An East Indian money of account, the sixteenth of a rupee, or about 2&unr_; cents.
See Annals .
To join or attach; usually to subjoin; to affix; to append; -- followed by to .
To disturb or irritate, especially by continued or repeated acts; to tease; to ruffle in mind; to vex; as, I was annoyed by his remarks.
To reduce to nothing; to obliterate.
the other world; land of fairies.
A small wild ox of Celebes ( Anoa depressicornis ), allied to the buffalo, but having long nearly straight horns.
The positive pole of an electric battery, or more strictly the electrode by which the current enters the electrolyte on its way to the other pole; -- opposed to cathode .
To anoint with oil.
A small arboreal tropical American insectivorous lizard ( Anolis carolinensis ) with the ability to change skin color.
Disregard or violation of law.
Straightway; at once.
A genus of tropical or subtropical plants of the natural order Anonaceæ , including the soursop.
A name given to either of the projecting ends of Saturn's ring.
A hymenopterous insect of the Linnæan genus Formica , which is now made a family of several genera; an emmet; a pismire.
A species of pier produced by thickening a wall at its termination, treated architecturally as a pilaster, with capital and base.
Each player's stake, which is put into the pool before ( ante ) the game begins.
Antæ. See Anta .
A prefix meaning against , opposite or opposed to , contrary , or in place of ; -- used in composition in many English words. It is often shortened to ant- ; as, ant acid, ant arctic .
Old; antique.
One of the orders of amphibians characterized by the absence of a tail, as the frogs and toads.
Nonsecretion or defective secretion of urine; ischury.
The posterior opening of the alimentary canal, through which the excrements are expelled.
An iron block, usually with a steel face, upon which metals are hammered and shaped.
One indifferently, out of an indefinite number; one indefinitely, whosoever or whatsoever it may be.
The great artery which carries the blood from the heart to all parts of the body except the lungs; the main trunk of the arterial system.
a genus of nocturnal South American monkeys with large eyes; the owl monkeys; the douroucoulis. See douroucouli .
With a quick pace; quick; fast; speedily.
Paid; pleased.
To impair or become impaired; to injure.
See Mataco .
Separately, in regard to space or company; in a state of separation as to place; aside.

A quadrumanous mammal, esp. of the family Simiadæ , having teeth of the same number and form as in man, and possessing neither a tail nor cheek pouches. The name is applied esp. to species of the genus Hylobates , and is sometimes used as a general term for all Quadrumana. The higher forms, the gorilla, chimpanzee, and ourang, are often called anthropoid apes or man apes .
In a vertical line. The anchor in apeak , when the cable has been sufficiently hove in to bring the ship over it, and the ship is them said to be hove apeak .
One who apes.
Open; evident; undisguised.
A place where apes are kept.
The tip, top, point, or angular summit of anything; as, the apex of a mountain, spire, or cone; the apex , or tip, of a leaf.
One of the genus Aphis; an aphidian.
A genus of insects belonging to the order Hemiptera and family Aphidæ , including numerous species known as plant lice and green flies.
The capital city of Samoa . Population (2000) = 32,859.
Belonging to bees.
An oily liquid derived from parsley.
A genus of insects of the order Hymenoptera, including the common honeybee ( Apis mellifica ) and other related species. See Honeybee .
Having the qualities of an ape; prone to imitate in a servile manner. Hence: Apelike; fantastically silly; foppish; affected; trifling.
transient cessation of respiration.
A prefix from a Greek preposition. It usually signifies from , away from , off , or asunder , separate ; as, in apo cope (a cutting off ), apo state, apo stle (one sent away ), apo carpous .
Without feet; footless.
A group of cirripeds, destitute of footlike organs.
On or towards the port or left side; -- said of the helm.
To pay; to satisfy or appease.
A tap or stamp of the foot as a warning of intent to attack; -- called also attack .
The fleshy pome or fruit of a rosaceous tree ( Pyrus malus ) cultivated in numberless varieties in the temperate zones.
To lay or place; to put or adjust (one thing to another); -- with to ; as, to apply the hand to the breast; to apply medicaments to a diseased part of the body.
A support or supporter; a stay; a prop.
The fourth month of the year.

An article of dress, of cloth, leather, or other stuff, worn on the fore part of the body, to keep the clothes clean, to defend them from injury, or as a covering. It is commonly tied at the waist by strings.

A projecting part of a building, esp. of a church, having in the plan a polygonal or semicircular termination, and, most often, projecting from the east end. In early churches the Eastern apse was occupied by seats for the bishop and clergy.

One of the two points of an orbit, as of a planet or satellite, which are at the greatest and least distance from the central body, corresponding to the aphelion and perihelion of a planet, or to the apogee and perigee of the moon. The more distant is called the higher apsis ; the other, the lower apsis ; and the line joining them, the line of apsides .
father of the gods and consort of Tiamat.
Fit or fitted; suited; suitable; appropriate.
In an apt or suitable manner; fitly; properly; pertinently; appropriately; readily.
A genus of fresh-water phyllopod crustaceans. See Phyllopod .
Water; -- a word much used in pharmacy and the old chemistry, in various signification, determined by the word or words annexed.
Ere; before.
The Altar; a southern constellation, south of the tail of the Scorpion.
One of a swarthy race occupying Arabia, and numerous in Syria, Northern Africa, etc.
A wagon or cart, usually heavy and without springs, and often covered.
The country of Arabia.
To tear up by the roots; to draw away.
Same as Arrack .
The palm (or great black) cockatoo, of Australia ( Microglossus aterrimus ).
Lord of Annwfn (the other world; land of fairies).
Someone who engages in arbitrage (who purchases securities in one market for immediate resale in another in the hope of profiting from the price differential); shortened form of arbitrageur .
A kind of latticework formed of, or covered with, vines, branches of trees, or other plants, for shade; a bower.
A portion of a curved line; as, the arc of a circle or of an ellipse .
the type genus of the family Arcidae , including ark shells and blood clams.
Any part of a curved line.
Arched; as, archy brows .
Heat, in a literal sense; as, the ardor of the sun's rays .
The present indicative plural of the substantive verb to be ; but etymologically a different word from be , or was . Am , art , are , and is , all come from the root as .
Any plane surface, as of the floor of a room or church, or of the ground within an inclosure; an open space in a building.
To tell, declare, explain, or interpret; to divine; to guess; as, to aread a riddle or a dream .
Of or pertaining to an area; as, areal interstices (the areas or spaces inclosed by the reticulate vessels of leaves) .
To raise; to set up; to stir up.
A genus of palms, one species of which ( Areca catechu ) produces the areca nut, or betel nut, which is chewed in India and Southeast Asia with the leaf of the Piper Betle and lime.
In a reeking condition.
To dry, or make dry.
The area in the central part of an amphitheater, in which the gladiators fought and other shows were exhibited; -- so called because it was covered with sand.
A palm tree ( Saguerus saccharifer ) which furnishes sago, wine, and fibers for ropes; the gomuti palm.
See Arear .
A support for the spear when couched for the attack.
To reckon; to ascribe; to impute.
Crude tartar. See Argol .
A genus of venomous ticks which attack men and animals. The famous Persian Argas, also called Miana bug , is Argas Persicus ; that of Central America , called talaje by the natives, is Argas Talaje .
Clay, or potter's earth; sometimes pure clay, or alumina. See Clay .
The name of the ship which carried Jason and his fifty-four companions to Colchis, in quest of the Golden Fleece.
Crude tartar; an acidulous salt from which cream of tartar is prepared. It exists in the juice of grapes, and is deposited from wines on the sides of the casks.

A colorless, odorless gas occurring in the air (of which it constitutes 0.93 per cent by volume), in volcanic gases, etc.; -- so named on account of its inertness by Rayleigh and Ramsay, who prepared and examined it in 1894-95. Symbol, A ; at. wt., 39.9. Argon is condensible to a colorless liquid boiling at -186.1° C. and to a solid melting at -189.6° C. It has a characteristic spectrum. No compounds of it are known, but there is physical evidence that its molecule is monatomic. Weight of one liter at 0° C. and 760 mm., 1.7828 g.
an ancient city in SE Greece; dominated the Peloponnese in the 7th century BC.
A secret language or conventional slang peculiar to thieves, tramps, and vagabonds; flash.
To invent and offer reasons to support or overthrow a proposition, opinion, or measure; to use arguments; to reason.
A fabulous being of antiquity, said to have had a hundred eyes, who has placed by Juno to guard Io . His eyes were transplanted to the peacock's tail.
a Buddhist who has attained nirvana.
An air or song; a melody; a tune.
See Aryan .
Exhausted of moisture; parched with heat; dry; barren.
A variety of the gazelle ( Antilope dorcas , or Gazella, dorcas ), found in Arabia and adjacent countries.
The Ram; the first of the twelve signs in the zodiac, which the sun enters at the vernal equinox, about the 21st of March.
A exterior covering, forming a false coat or appendage to a seed, as the loose, transparent bag inclosing the seed of the white water lily. The mace of the nutmeg is also an aril .

In Greek legend, a fabulous horse, the offspring of Poseidon by Demeter (or, in other accounts, Gaea or a harpy) who to escape him had metamorphosed herself into a mare. It was successively owned by Copreus, Oncus, Heracles, and Adrastus. It possessed marvelous powers of speech, and its right feet were those of a man.

To come up from a lower to a higher position; to come above the horizon; to come up from one's bed or place of repose; to mount; to ascend; to rise; as, to arise from a kneeling posture; a cloud arose ; the sun ariseth ; he arose early in the morning.
3d sing. pres. of Arise , for ariseth .
A chest, or coffer.
An earnest; earnest money; money paid to bind a bargain.
The limb of the human body which extends from the shoulder to the hand; also, the corresponding limb of a monkey.
Furnished with weapons of offense or defense; furnished with the means of security or protection.
A kind of helmet worn in the 14th, 15th, and 16th centuries.
A bracelet.
Defensive arms for the body; any clothing or covering worn to protect one's person in battle.
Instruments or weapons of offense or defense.
A collection or body of men armed for war, esp. one organized in companies, battalions, regiments, brigades, and divisions, under proper officers.
The wild buffalo of India ( Bos, or Bubalus, arni ), larger than the domestic buffalo and having enormous horns.
The earthnut.
Belonging to, or resembling, the Arum family of plants ( Araceae ).
The quality or principle of plants or other substances which constitutes their fragrance; agreeable odor; as, the aroma of coffee .
A barbarous word used by the old chemists to designate various medical remedies.
The past or preterit tense of Arise .
In a row, line, or rank; successively; in order.
Tapestry; a rich figured fabric; especially, a screen or hangings of heavy cloth with interwoven figures.
Order; a regular and imposing arrangement; disposition in regular lines; hence, order of battle; as, drawn up in battle array .
Same as Aret .
Money or other valuable thing given to evidence a contract; a pledge or earnest.

The sharp edge or salient angle formed by two surfaces meeting each other, whether plane or curved; -- applied particularly to the edges in moldings, and to the raised edges which separate the flutings in a Doric column.
A missile weapon of offense, slender, pointed, and usually feathered and barbed, to be shot from a bow.
The buttocks, or hind part of an animal; the posteriors; the fundament; the bottom.
That part of a foot where the ictus is put, or which is distinguished from the rest (known as the thesis ) of the foot by a greater stress of voice.
The malicious burning of a dwelling house or outhouse of another man, which by the common law is felony; the malicious and voluntary firing of a building or ship.

The second person singular, indicative mode, present tense, of the substantive verb Be ; but formed after the analogy of the plural are , with the ending - t , as in thou shal t , wil t , orig. an ending of the second person sing. pret. Cf. Be . Now used only in solemn or poetical style.
With art or skill.
A contraction of art thou .
same as arty .
showily imitative of art or artists.
a wild sheep ( Ammotragus lervia ) of northern Africa, having a thick mane on the throat, chest, and forelegs; -- also called the aoudad and Barbary sheep .
A genus of plants found in central Europe and about the Mediterranean, having flowers on a spadix inclosed in a spathe. The cuckoopint of the English is an example.
mother and earth goddess in Gilgamish epic; identified with Sumerian Ki and Ninkhursag (Mama; Nintu).
A funeral feast.

One of a primitive people supposed to have lived in prehistoric times, in Central Asia, east of the Caspian Sea, and north of the Hindu Kush and Paropamisan Mountains, and to have been the stock from which sprang the Hindu, Persian, Greek, Latin, Celtic, Teutonic, Slavonic, and other races; one of that ethnological division of mankind called also Indo-European or Indo-Germanic.

Denoting equality or likeness in kind, degree, or manner; like; similar to; in the same manner with or in which; in accordance with; in proportion to; to the extent or degree in which or to which; equally; no less than; as, ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil; you will reap as you sow; do as you are bidden.
An ancient name of a gum.
the American Society of Cinematographers.
the American Society of Cinematographers.
See Ascus .
Persons who, at certain times of the year, have no shadow at noon; -- applied to the inhabitants of the torrid zone, who have, twice a year, a vertical sun.
a cravat with wide square ends, tied so that the ends are laid flat; the ends are often secured with an ornamental pin; -- called cravat in Britain.
A small membranous bladder or tube in which are inclosed the seedlike reproductive particles or sporules of lichens and certain fungi.

A genus of trees of the Olive family, having opposite pinnate leaves, many of the species furnishing valuable timber, as the European ash ( Fraxinus excelsior ) and the white ash ( Fraxinus Americana ).
Of or pertaining to the ash tree.
The earthy or mineral particles of combustible substances remaining after combustion, as of wood or coal.
Pertaining to, or composed of, ashes; filled, or strewed with, ashes.
Of or pertaining to Asia; Asiatic.
On, or to, one side; out of a straight line, course, or direction; at a little distance from the rest; out of the way; apart.
To request; to seek to obtain by words; to petition; to solicit; -- often with of , in the sense of from , before the person addressed.
One who asks; a petitioner; an inquirer.
Awry; askance; asquint; oblique or obliquely; -- sometimes indicating scorn, or contempt, or entry.
same as American sign language , the sign language used in the US.
Sluggishly.
Same as Aspen .
One of several species of poplar bearing this name, especially the Populus tremula , so called from the trembling of its leaves, which move with the slightest impulse of the air.
Rough; rugged; harsh; bitter; stern; fierce.
The venomous asp.

A quadruped of the genus Equus ( Equus asinus ), smaller than the horse, and having a peculiarly harsh bray and long ears. The tame or domestic ass is patient, slow, and sure-footed, and has become the type of obstinacy and stupidity. There are several species of wild asses which are swift-footed.
A direction equivalent to very ; as, adagio assai , very slow .
Trial; attempt; essay.
A small foxlike animal ( Vulpes cama ) of South Africa, valued for its fur.
Any article or separable part of one's assets.
To besot; to befool; to beguile; to infatuate.
an ancient Assyrian city.
An anchor is said to be astay , when, in heaving it, an acute angle is formed between the cable and the surface of the water.
An arch, or ceiling, of boards, placed over the men's heads in a mine.
A genus of herbs with compound white or bluish flowers; starwort; Michaelmas daisy.
Stirring; in a state of activity or motion; out of bed.
To stun; to astonish; to stupefy.
An enemy of the gods, esp. one of a race of demons and giants.

Primarily, this word expresses the relations of presence , nearness in place or time , or direction toward ; as, at the ninth hour; at the house; to aim at a mark. It is less definite than in or on ; at the house may be in or near the house. From this original import are derived all the various uses of at .
To overtake.
essential oil or perfume obtained from flowers.
the preterit of Eat .
essential oil or perfume obtained from flowers.
In the manner of a tilter; in the position, or with the action, of one making a thrust.
Public disgrace or stigma; infamy; loss of civil rights.
One who sustains a great burden.
The life principle, soul, or individual essence.

The standard atmospheric pressure used in certain physical measurements calculations; conventionally, that pressure under which the barometer stands at 760 millimeters, at a temperature of 0° Centigrade, at the level of the sea, and in the latitude of Paris.
A porridge or gruel of maize meal and water, milk, or the like.
A coral island or islands, consisting of a belt of coral reef, partly submerged, surrounding a central lagoon or depression; a lagoon island.
An ultimate indivisible particle of matter.
An atom; a mite; a pigmy.
In concord or friendship; in agreement (with each other); as, to be, bring, make, or set, at one , i . e., to be or bring in or to a state of agreement or reconciliation.
Want of tone; weakness of the system, or of any organ, especially of such as are contractile.
On or at the top.
Just hove clear of the ground; -- said of the anchor.
Same as Attle .
A fragrant essential oil; esp., a volatile and highly fragrant essential oil obtained from the petals of roses.
Poison; venom; corrupt matter from a sore.
Of or pertaining to Attica, in Greece, or to Athens, its principal city; marked by such qualities as were characteristic of the Athenians; classical; refined.
Rubbish or refuse consisting of broken rock containing little or no ore.
Poisonous; malignant; malicious.
In two; in twain; asunder.

the unit of length equal to the mean distance of the Earth from the sun, about 93 million miles (150 million kiometers); -- used almost exclusively in astronomy, or to describe astronomical distances.
A broken gait of a horse, between an amble and a gallop; -- commonly called a Canterbury gallop .
same as aoudad .
An English poet in the U. S. Born 1907, died 1973.
the part of a transmitted signal which conveys the sound of the event represented by the signal, such as that of a television program.
An audience; a hearing.
A changeling or elf child, -- that is, one left by fairies; a deformed or foolish child; a simpleton; an oaf.

A carpenter's tool for boring holes larger than those bored by a gimlet. It has a handle placed crosswise by which it is turned with both hands. A pod auger is one with a straight channel or groove, like the half of a bean pod. A screw auger has a twisted blade, by the spiral groove of which the chips are discharge.
A priming tube connecting the charge chamber with the gallery, or place where the slow match is applied.
Property; possession.

An official diviner who foretold events by the singing, chattering, flight, and feeding of birds, or by signs or omens derived from celestial phenomena, certain appearances of quadrupeds, or unusual occurrences.

A name given to various species of arctic sea birds of the family Alcidæ . The great auk, now extinct, is Alca impennis ( or Plautus impennis ) . The razor-billed auk is Alca torda . See Puffin , Guillemot , and Murre .
Old; as, Auld Reekie (old smoky), i. e. , Edinburgh .
Pertaining to a royal court.
An ell. [Obs.] See Aune .
Same as Aam .
A French cloth measure, of different parts of the country (at Paris, 0.95 of an English ell); -- now superseded by the meter .
The sister of one's father or mother; -- correlative to nephew or niece . Also applied to an uncle's wife.
Any subtile, invisible emanation, effluvium, or exhalation from a substance, as the aroma of flowers, the odor of the blood, a supposed fertilizing emanation from the pollen of flowers, etc.
Of or pertaining to the air, or to an aura.
Of or pertaining to gold.
A red coloring matter derived from phenol; -- called also, in commerce, yellow corallin .
An abbreviation of automobile .
a substance which, in small concentrations, promotes root formation, bud growth, or certain other processes such as fruit ripening or leaf drop in plants.
the eleventh month of the civil year; the fifth month of the ecclesiastical year in the Jewish calendar (in July and August).
Same as Kava .
To turn to the advantage of; to be of service to; to profit; to benefit; to help; as, artifices will not avail the sinner in the day of judgment .
To cause to descend; to lower; to let fall; to doff.
The front of an army. [Obs.] See Van .
Cease; stop; stay.
An ave Maria.
To pull away.
A genus of grasses, including the common oat ( Avena sativa ); the oat grasses.
A plant of the genus Geum , of the rose family, esp. Geum urbanum , or herb bennet. They may bear red, yellow, or white flowers.
A work horse, or working ox.
To turn aside, or away; as, to avert the eyes from an object ; to ward off, or prevent, the occurrence or effects of; as, how can the danger be averted ? “To avert his ire.”
The class of Vertebrata that includes the birds.
Of or instrument to birds.
Longing eagerly for; eager; greedy.
To abase or debase; to vilify; to depreciate.
Advice; opinion; deliberation.
To look at; to view; to think of.
Information; advice.
To retire; to withdraw.
To call from or back again.
To declare openly, as something believed to be right; to own or acknowledge frankly; as, a man avows his principles or his crimes .
To watch for; to look out for.
To rouse from sleep; to wake; to awaken.
To give by sentence or judicial determination; to assign or apportion, after careful regard to the nature of the case; to adjudge; as, the arbitrators awarded damages to the complainant .
Watchful; vigilant or on one's guard against danger or difficulty.
Washed by the waves or tide; -- said of a rock or strip of shore;
From a place; hence.
Dread; great fear mingled with respect.
Oppressing with fear or horror; appalling; terrible; as, an awful scene .
On the wing; flying; fluttering.
Perversely; in the wrong way.
In an unlucky (left-handed) or perverse manner.

A pointed instrument for piercing small holes, as in leather or wood; used by shoemakers, saddlers, cabinetmakers, etc. The blade is differently shaped and pointed for different uses, as in the brad awl , saddler's awl , shoemaker's awl , etc.
The bristle or beard of barley, oats, grasses, etc., or any similar bristlelike appendage; arista.
Furnished with an awn, or long bristle-shaped tip; bearded.
Having awns; bearded.
At work; in action.
Turned or twisted toward one side; not in a straight or true direction, or position; out of the right course; distorted; obliquely; asquint; with oblique vision; as, to glance awry .

A tool or instrument of steel, or of iron with a steel edge or blade, for felling trees, chopping and splitting wood, hewing timber, etc. It is wielded by a wooden helve or handle, so fixed in a socket or eye as to be in the same plane with the blade. The broadax , or carpenter's ax, is an ax for hewing timber, made heavier than the chopping ax, and with a broader and thinner blade and a shorter handle.
[See Axial .]
See Ax , Axman .
Of or pertaining to an axis; of the nature of, or resembling, an axis; around an axis.
The angle or point of divergence between the upper side of a branch, leaf, or petiole, and the stem or branch from which it springs.
Situated in the axis of anything; as an embryo which lies in the axis of a seed.

A self-evident and necessary truth, or a proposition whose truth is so evident as first sight that no reasoning or demonstration can make it plainer; a proposition which it is necessary to take for granted; as, “The whole is greater than a part;” “A thing can not, at the same time, be and not be.”
The spotted deer ( Cervus axis or Axis maculata ) of India, where it is called hog deer and parrah (Moorish name).
The pin or spindle on which a wheel revolves, or which revolves with a wheel.
Having an axle; -- used in composition.
One who wields an ax.
Same as Aye .
A native nurse for children; also, a lady's maid.
Yes; yea; -- a word expressing assent, or an affirmative answer to a question. It is much used in viva voce voting in legislative bodies, etc.
Again; back against.
A grandfather.
The utterance of the ejaculation “Ay me !” [Obs.] See Ay , interj .
See Aerie .
a compound containing the azido group combined with an element or radical.
relating to or containing the azido group -N3 .
Destitute of any vestige of organic life, or at least of animal life; anterior to the existence of animal life; formed when there was no animal life on the globe; as, the azoic . rocks.

Any of a large class of compounds characterized by a five-membered ring which contains an atom of nitrogen and at least one other noncarbon atom (nitrogen, oxygen, sulphur). The prefixes furo- , thio , and pyrro- are used to distinguish three subclasses of azoles, which may be regarded as derived respectively from furfuran, thiophene, and pyrrol by replacement of the CH group by nitrogen; as, furo -monazole . Names exactly analogous to those for the azines are also used; as, oxazole , diazole , etc.
Same as Nitrogen .
The first principle of metals, i. e. , mercury, which was formerly supposed to exist in all metals, and to be extractable from them.
same as azidothymidine .
Of or relating to one of the early races in Mexico that inhabited the great plateau of that country at the time of the Spanish conquest in 1519.
Sky-blue; resembling the clear blue color of the unclouded sky; cerulean; also, cloudless.
Unleavened bread.
To cry baa, or bleat as a sheep.
The supreme male divinity of the Phoenician and Canaanitish nations.
Lit., gate; -- a title given to the founder of Babism, and taken from that of Bab-ud-Din , assumed by him.
A kind of plum cake.
The city and tower in the land of Shinar, where the confusion of languages took place.
A Hindu gentleman; a native clerk who writes English; also, a Hindu title equivalent to the English Mr. or Esquire .
Any one of several species of Acacia , esp. Acacia Arabica , which yelds a gum used as a substitute for true gum arabic.
An infant or young child of either sex; a babe.
A broad, flat-bottomed ferryboat, usually worked by a rope.
an indehiscent fruit derived from a single ovary having one or many seeds within a fleshy wall or pericarp: e. g. grape; tomato; cranberry.
A large shallow vat; a cistern, tub, or trough, used by brewers, distillers, dyers, picklers, gluemakers, and others, for mixing or cooling wort, holding water, hot glue, etc.
Among leather dealers, the thickest and stoutest tanned hides.
The back and sides of a pig salted and smoked; formerly, the flesh of a pig salted or fresh.

Wanting good qualities, whether physical or moral; injurious, hurtful, inconvenient, offensive, painful, unfavorable, or defective, either physically or morally; evil; vicious; wicked; -- the opposite of good ; as, a bad man; bad conduct; bad habits; bad soil; bad air; bad health; a bad crop; bad news .
A form of the past tense of Bid .
A distinctive mark, token, sign, or cognizance, worn on the person; as, the badge of a society; the badge of a policeman .
In a bad manner; poorly; not well; unskillfully; imperfectly; unfortunately; grievously; so as to cause harm; disagreeably; seriously.
A blow; a stroke; thud.
A short wooden club having a deeply concave face, seldom used.
Same as Bafta .
A coarse stuff, usually of cotton, originally made in India. Also, an imitation of this fabric made for export.
A sack or pouch, used for holding anything; as, a bag of meal or of money .
a glazed leavened doughnut-shaped roll with a hard crust.
Resembling a bag; loose or puffed out, or pendent, like a bag; flabby; as, baggy trousers; baggy cheeks .
The annular molding or group of moldings dividing a long shaft or clustered column into two or more parts.
An exclamation expressive of extreme contempt.

A member of the sect of the Babis consisting of the adherents of Baha ( Mirza Husain Ali , entitled “Baha 'u 'llah,” or, “the Splendor of God”), the elder half brother of Mirza Yahya of Nur, who succeeded the Bab as the head of the Babists. Baha in 1863 declared himself the supreme prophet of the sect, and became its recognized head. There are upwards of 20,000 Bahais in the United States.
A weight used in certain parts of the East Indies, varying considerably in different localities, the range being from 223 to 625 pounds.
a language spoken in the Dali region of Yunnan.
A bucket or scoop used in bailing water out of a boat.
A bath; a bagnio.
Any substance, esp. food, used in catching fish, or other animals, by alluring them to a hook, snare, inclosure, or net.
A coarse woolen stuff with a long nap; -- usually dyed in plain colors.
To prepare, as food, by cooking in a dry heat, either in an oven or under coals, or on heated stone or metal; as, to bake bread, meat, apples .
dried out by heat or excessive exposure to sunlight.
p. p. of Bake .
One whose business it is to bake bread, biscuit, etc.
The capital city of Azerbaijan . Population (2000) = 1,713,300.
Destitute of the natural or common covering on the head or top, as of hair, feathers, foliage, trees, etc.; as, a bald head; a bald oak .
a person who has a bald head; -- a deprecatory term.
A bundle or package of goods in a cloth cover, and corded for storage or transportation; also, a bundle of straw, hay, etc., put up compactly for transportation.
A ridge of land left unplowed between furrows, or at the end of a field; a piece missed by the plow slipping aside.
Apt to balk; as, a balky horse .
Any round or roundish body or mass; a sphere or globe; as, a ball of twine; a ball of snow .
an informal intensifier.
To anoint with balm, or with anything medicinal.
Having the qualities of balm; odoriferous; aromatic; assuaging; soothing; refreshing; mild; as, balmy weather .
A raft or float, used principally on the Pacific coast of South America.
An imposition; a cheat; a hoax.
A kind of fine muslin, made in the East Indies from the fiber of the banana leaf stalks.
Commonplace; trivial; hackneyed; trite.
The territory governed by a ban.
A bench; a high seat, or seat of distinction or judgment; a tribunal or court.
A bank, especially that of Venice.
A fillet, strap, or any narrow ligament with which a thing is encircled, or fastened, or by which a number of things are tied, bound together, or confined; a fetter.
A carriage or cart used in India, esp. one drawn by bullocks.
That which destroys life, esp. poison of a deadly quality.
To beat, as with a club or cudgel; to treat with violence; to handle roughly.
A stringed musical instrument having a head and neck like the guitar, and a circular body like a tambourine. It has five strings, and is played with the fingers and hands.
A mound, pile, or ridge of earth, raised above the surrounding level; hence, anything shaped like a mound or ridge of earth; as, a bank of clouds; a bank of snow .
Notice of a proposed marriage, proclaimed in a church, or other place prescribed by law, in order that any person may object, if he knows of just cause why the marriage should not take place.

A member of one of the great family of Negroid tribes occupying equatorial and southern Africa. These tribes include, as important divisions, the Kafirs, Damaras, Bechuanas, and many tribes whose names begin with Aba- , Ama- , Ba- , Ma- , Wa- , variants of the Bantu plural personal prefix Aba- , as in Ba-ntu , or Aba-ntu , itself a combination of this prefix with the syllable -ntu , a person; or as in Watusi .

A piece of wood, metal, or other material, long in proportion to its breadth or thickness, used as a lever and for various other purposes, but especially for a hindrance, obstruction, or fastening; as, the bars of a fence or gate; the bar of a door .
The pressure of one dyne per square centimeter; -- used as a unit of pressure.
Beard, or that which resembles it, or grows in the place of it.
A professional poet and singer, as among the ancient Celts, whose occupation was to compose and sing verses in honor of the heroic achievements of princes and brave men.
Surface; body; substance.
A pleasure boat; a vessel or boat of state, elegantly furnished and decorated.
Of or pertaining to barium; as, baric oxide .
To strip the bark from; to peel.
Covered with, or containing, bark.
Foam rising upon beer, or other malt liquors, when fermenting, and used as leaven in making bread and in brewing; yeast.
Full of barm or froth; in a ferment.
A covered building used chiefly for storing grain, hay, and other productions of a farm. In the United States a part of the barn is often used for stables.
Divided into bars; -- said of the field.
The common perch. See 1st Bass .
an abbreviation of baronet .
A place of shelter for cattle.
Relating to, or forming, the base.
Same as Basil , a sheepskin.
Of little, or less than the usual, height; of low growth; as, base shrubs .
Having a base, or having as a base; supported; as, broad- based .
To abash; to disconcert or be disconcerted or put out of countenance.
Relating to a base; performing the office of a base in a salt.
The slope or angle to which the cutting edge of a tool, as a plane, is ground.
The foundation of anything; that on which a thing rests.
To lie in warmth; to be exposed to genial heat.
An edible, spiny-finned fish, esp. of the genera Roccus , Labrax , and related genera. There are many species.
See Bashaw .
The bass or lowest part; as, to sing basso .
The inner fibrous bark of various plants; esp. of the lime tree; hence, matting, cordage, etc., made therefrom.
Enough; stop.
To beat with a stick; to cudgel.
The ace of clubs in quadrille and omber.
To strike or hit with a bat or a pole; to cudgel; to beat.
Strife; contention.
Reduced; lowered; restrained; as, to speak with bated breath .

The act of exposing the body, or part of the body, for purposes of cleanliness, comfort, health, etc., to water, vapor, hot air, or the like; as, a cold or a hot bath ; a medicated bath ; a steam bath ; a hip bath .
To wash by immersion, as in a bath; to subject to a bath.
A dyed fabric with designs drawn on by applying a removable wax where the dye is not wanted.
A small genus of plants constituting the family Batidaceae : low straggling dioecious shrubs.
A staff or truncheon, used for various purposes; as, the baton of a field marshal; the baton of a conductor in musical performances .
Crazy; insane; loony; demented; batty.
Extra pay; esp. an extra allowance to an English officer serving in India.
Belonging to, or resembling, a bat.
A small copper coin, with a mixture of silver, formerly current in some parts of Germany and Switzerland. It was worth about four cents.

A unit of transmission speed for information conveyed over a digital communications channel, usually taken as equal to the number of bits of information transmitted per second. The speed in bauds indicates the number of signalling events per second; however, since it is necessary in most cases to transmit control information along with the data, the data signalling rate may be smaller than the baud rate.
A fagot of brushwood, or other light combustible matter, for kindling fires; refuse of brushwood.
A person who keeps a house of prostitution, or procures women for a lewd purpose; a procurer or procuress; a lewd person; -- usually applied to a woman.
Dirty; foul; -- said of clothes.
To cry out with a loud, full sound; to cry with vehemence, as in calling or exultation; to shout; to vociferate.
An inclosure with mud or stone walls, for keeping cattle; a fortified inclosure.
Reddish brown; of the color of a chestnut; -- applied to the color of horses.
The East Indian weaver bird ( Ploceus Philippinus ).
A large, edible, siluroid fish of the Nile, of two species ( Bagrina bayad and Bagrina docmac ).
Having a bay or bays.
An inlet from the Gulf of Mexico, from a lake, or from a large river, sometimes sluggish, sometimes without perceptible movement except from tide and wind.
See Baize .
before Christ; used in reckoning dates before the supposed year Christ was born, i.e. 1 a. d. .
To exist actually, or in the world of fact; to have existence.
Pebbles, collectively; shingle.
To ornament with beads or beading.
Resembling beads; small, round, and glistening.
The bill or nib of a bird, consisting of a horny sheath, covering the jaws. The form varies much according to the food and habits of the bird, and is largely used in the classification of birds.
A small inflammatory tumor; a pustule.
Any large piece of timber or iron long in proportion to its thickness, and prepared for use.
Emitting beams of light; radiant; shining.
A name given to the seed of certain leguminous herbs, chiefly of the genera Faba , Phaseolus , and Dolichos ; also, to the herbs.
a game in which numbered balls are drawn and random and players cover the correponding numbers on their cards.
same as beanie .
To support or sustain; to hold up.
To take by the beard; to seize, pluck, or pull the beard of (a man), in anger or contempt.
See Bairn .
Any living creature; an animal; -- including man, insects, etc.
To strike repeatedly; to lay repeated blows upon; as, to beat one's breast; to beat iron so as to shape it; to beat grain, in order to force out the seeds; to beat eggs and sugar; to beat a drum .
To bathe; also, to dry or heat, as unseasoned wood.
A man who takes great care to dress in the latest fashion; a dandy.
an outstanding example of its kind; as, when I make a mistake it's a beaut .
pl. of Beau .
A small brook.

An article of furniture to sleep or take rest in or on; a couch. Specifically: A sack or mattress, filled with some soft material, in distinction from the bedstead on which it is placed (as, a feather bed ), or this with the bedclothes added. In a general sense, any thing or place used for sleeping or reclining on or in, as a quantity of hay, straw, leaves, or twigs.
To pray; also, to offer; to proffer.
Same as Beadle .
The Abyssinian or Arabian ibex ( Capra Nubiana ). It is probably the wild goat of the Bible.
To moisten with dew, or as with dew.
To make dim; to obscure or darken.
To dye or stain.
p. p. of Be ; -- used for been .
A tree of the genus Fagus .
An animal of the genus Bos , especially the common species, Bos taurus , including the bull, cow, and ox, in their full grown state; esp., an ox or cow fattened for food.
Having much beef; of the nature of beef; resembling beef; fleshy.
Same as Beild .
The past participle of Be . In old authors it is also the pr. tense plural of Be . See 1st Bee .
A fermented liquor made from any malted grain, but commonly from barley malt, with hops or some other substance to impart a bitter flavor.
Of or resembling beer; affected by beer; maudlin.
A biennial plant of the genus Beta , which produces an edible root the first year and seed the second year.
To mend; to repair.
A beef; a beef creature.
To be suitable to; to suit; to become.
To involve in a fog; -- mostly as a participle or part. adj.
A title of honor in Turkey and in some other parts of the East; a bey.
See Bigha .
To adorn with gems, or as with gems.
To procreate, as a father or sire; to generate; -- commonly said of the father.
To have or commence an independent or first existence; to take rise; to commence.
To exalt to the dignity of a god; to deify.
imp. & p. p. of Beget .
In the East Indies, a princess or lady of high rank.
p. p. of Begin .
The Centaurea behen , or saw-leaved centaury.
A place of shelter; protection; refuge.
Existence, as opposed to nonexistence; state or sphere of existence.
Half a shekel.
The Babylonian name of the god known among the Hebrews as Baal . See Baal .
To beat or bang.
To lay on or cover; to adorn.
To eject or throw up from the stomach with violence; to eruct.
To place under the lee, or unfavorably to the wind.
To show to be false; to convict of, or charge with, falsehood.
A hollow metallic vessel, usually shaped somewhat like a cup with a flaring mouth, containing a clapper or tongue, and giving forth a ringing sound on being struck.
A young lady of superior beauty and attractions; a handsome lady, or one who attracts notice in society; a fair lady.
That part of the human body which extends downward from the breast to the thighs, and contains the bowels, or intestines; the abdomen.
Under, or lower in place; beneath not so high; as, below the moon; below the knee .
That which engirdles a person or thing; a band or girdle; as, a lady's belt ; a sword belt .
To make mad.
The sign ♭; the same as B flat.
The seed of one or more species of moringa; as, oil of ben . See Moringa .
A long seat, differing from a stool in its greater length.
To strain or move out of a straight line; to crook by straining; to make crooked; to curve; to make ready for use by drawing into a curve; as, to bend a bow; to bend the knee .
Divided into an even number of bends; -- said of a shield or its charge.
See Benne .
To catch in a net; to insnare.
To take away.

The name of two plants ( Sesamum orientale and Sesamum indicum ), originally Asiatic; -- also called oil plant . From their seeds an oil is expressed, called benne oil or sesame oil , used mostly for making soap. In the southern United States the seeds are used in candy.
an East Indian annual erect herb ( Sesamum indicum ); the source of sesame seed or benniseed and sesame oil . Same as benne
same as benne or benni .
imp. & p. p. of Bend .
Abounding in bents, or the stalks of coarse, stiff, withered grass; as, benty fields .
To make foul; to soil; to defile.
An African genet ( Genetta pardina ). See Genet .
a sauce prepared from butter creamed with white wine, shallots, parsley and fish stock; -- also called Bercy sauce .
See Bear , barley.
a cap made of soft cloth with no brim or bill, widening somewhat outward from a close-fitting headband to a flat top, which often has a button or tab in its center.
A large mass or hill, as of ice.
A narrow shelf or path between the bottom of a parapet and the ditch.
The capital city of Switzerland . Population (2000) = 129,423.
To rob; to plunder.
A small, oval, transparent jellyfish, belonging to the Ctenophora.
Any small fleshy fruit, as the strawberry, mulberry, huckleberry, etc.
To give an anchorage to, or a place to lie at; to place in a berth; as, she was berthed stem to stern with the Adelaide .

A mineral of great hardness, and, when transparent, of much beauty. It occurs in hexagonal prisms, commonly of a green or bluish green color, but also yellow, pink, and white. It is a silicate of aluminum and beryllium. The aquamarine is a transparent, sea-green variety used as a gem. The emerald is another variety highly prized in jewelry, and distinguished by its deep color, which is probably due to the presence of a little oxide of chromium.
To see; to look; to mind.
To set or stud (anything) with ornaments or prominent objects.
To suit; to fit; to become.
A brush of twigs for sweeping; a broom; anything which sweeps away or destroys.
To make sottish; to make dull or stupid; to stupefy; to infatuate.
Having good qualities in the highest degree; most good, kind, desirable, suitable, etc.; most excellent; as, the best man; the best road; the best cloth; the best abilities .
That which is laid, staked, or pledged, as between two parties, upon the event of a contest or any contingent issue; the act of giving such a pledge; a wager.
The second letter of the Greek alphabet, B, β. See B , and cf. etymology of Alphabet .
To better; to mend. See Beete .

A species of pepper ( Piper betle ), the leaves of which are chewed, with the areca or betel nut and a little shell lime, by the inhabitants of the East Indies. It is a woody climber with ovate many-nerved leaves.
the 2nd letter of the Hebrew alphabet.
A small brass Venetian coin.
A short bar used by thieves to wrench doors open.

Any angle other than a right angle; the angle which one surface makes with another when they are not at right angles; the slant or inclination of such surface; as, to give a bevel to the edge of a table or a stone slab; the bevel of a piece of timber .
A light repast between meals; a lunch.
A company; an assembly or collection of persons, especially of ladies.
To wet or moisten.
To cover (the head) with a wig.
A double slip of leather by which bells are fastened to a hawk's legs.
A governor of a province or district in the Turkish dominions; also, in some places, a prince or nobleman; a beg; as, the bey of Tunis .
The rim which encompasses and fastens a jewel or other object, as the crystal of a watch, in the cavity in which it is set.
An astringent and narcotic drug made from the dried leaves and seed capsules of wild hemp ( Cannabis Indica ), and chewed or smoked in the East as a means of intoxication. See Hasheesh .
A weight on the side of the ball used in the game of bowls, or a tendency imparted to the ball, which turns it from a straight line.
A small piece of cloth worn by children over the breast, to protect the clothes.
A bibcock. See Bib , n. , 3.
Pieces of timber bolted to certain parts of a mast to support the trestletrees.
A pale blue pigment, prepared from the native blue carbonate of copper, or from smalt; -- called also blue bice .
See Jigger .
imp. & p. p. of Bid .
A name used in calling a hen or chicken.
To dwell; to inhabit; to abide; to stay.
A shelter. Same as Beild .
A handbarrow or portable frame on which a corpse is placed or borne to the grave.
Cleft to the middle or slightly beyond the middle; opening with a cleft; divided by a linear sinus, with straight margins.
Having largeness of size; of much bulk or magnitude; of great size; large.
A two-horse chariot.
A bigamist.
See Big , n. & v.
A measure of land in India, varying from a third of an acre to an acre.
A corner, bend, or angle; a hollow; as, the bight of a horse's knee; the bight of an elbow .
In a tumid, swelling, blustering manner; haughtily; violently.
A trinket; a jewel; -- a word applied to anything small and of elegant workmanship.
A nest of wild bees, wasps, or ants; a swarm.
The East Indian name of a virulent poison extracted from Aconitum ferox or other species of aconite: also, the plant itself.
A rapier; a sword; so named from Bilbao , in Spain.

A yellow, or greenish, viscid fluid, usually alkaline in reaction, secreted by the liver. It passes into the intestines, where it aids in the digestive process. Its characteristic constituents are the bile salts, and coloring matters.
The protuberant part of a cask, which is usually in the middle.
Having the smell of bilge water.
A name applied to the amorphous or crystalline mass obtained from bile by the action of alcohol and ether. It is composed of a mixture of the sodium salts of the bile acids.
To frustrate or disappoint; to deceive or defraud, by nonfulfillment of engagement; to leave in the lurch; to give the slip to; as, to bilk a creditor .
A beak, as of a bird, or sometimes of a turtle or other animal.
A club; esp., a policeman's club. Also called billy club
a valuable fiber plant ( Hibiscus cannabinus ) of the East Indies now widespread in cultivation.
A box, frame, crib, or inclosed place, used as a receptacle for any commodity; as, a corn bin ; a wine bin ; a coal bin .
Twofold; double.
To tie, or confine with a cord, band, ligature, chain, etc.; to fetter; to make fast; as, to bind grain in bundles; to bind a prisoner .
The winding or twining stem of a hop vine or other climbing plant.
A heap or pile; as, a bing of wood .

a game commonly used for low-stakes gambling, in which numbered balls or slips are drawn at random and players cover the correponding numbers on their cards, called Bingo cards, which have square arrangement of such numbers. Each card has a different arrangement of the numbers, and the first player to cover all numbers in one row (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) is the winner, usually announcing that fact by a cry of “Bingo!”
A large species of barbel ( Barbus bynni ), found in the Nile, and much esteemed for food.

a specific type of complex ecological community characterized by specific environmental conditions and a distinctive group of plants and animals, maintained in a relatively stable equilibrium, such as a rain forest biome or prairie biome .
